They approved it. They actually—I can't believe they approved it. [gasp softly] Two hundred people, um, that's two hundred families who don't have to... God, I keep thinking about what almost happened. [relieved] You know, when I first pitched this restructuring plan, honestly, the board looked at me like I was, I mean, completely insane. But the numbers, they—the numbers worked. [excited] I knew they would work! It's just, er, nobody wanted to listen at first because it wasn't the traditional approach, right? 

[anxious] For three weeks I basically lived in that conference room, and like, every night I'd go home thinking, what if I'm wrong? What if I'm the reason these people—[pause] but no, no, we did it. [laugh] We actually pulled it off! The creditors agreed to the payment schedule, and um, the equity swap, it all just... clicked. 

[exhausted] I haven't slept properly in, hmm, I don't even know how long. But seeing their faces when we announced it today? [warm] The woman from accounting, she just started crying, and then, well, I started crying too. [chuckle] Two hundred jobs. That's not just numbers on a spreadsheet anymore, you know? That's—that's real people who get to keep their lives intact.
